result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:40 PM Defendant Cody D Crillo in court.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Cody D Crillo.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin   Preliminary hearing waived.    The Court finds that the defendant has waived their right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of their own free will and accepts the waiver, finds probable cause and binds the case over for further proceedings.   Took a break and he is now ready to continue 3:28 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

9:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody D Crillo in court.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Cody D Crillo. Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint. Waived reading of the complaint Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on September 27, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed. The defendant shall have no contact with Ethan Meacham of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

9:51 AM Defendant Cody D Crillo in court.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Did not get Criminal Complaint, he is to stop at DA's window and get another criminal complaint.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 09:20 am.
